metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1922 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
QEMU (aka Quick Emulator) built with the TPR optimization for 32-bit Windows guests support is vulnerable to a null pointer dereference flaw. It occurs while doing I/O port write operations via hmp interface. In that, 'current_cpu' remains null, which leads to the null pointer dereference. A user or process could use this flaw to crash the QEMU instance, resulting in DoS issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1922` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22
No subscription required

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.22').
